summary: This document contains a series of letters and memoranda between Jeffrey Epstein, his foundation, and Interlochen Center for the Arts regarding significant financial donations and in-kind gifts. The correspondence details a $15,004 donation for a scholarship lodge, a $185,000 wire transfer, a $20,000 gift, and the provision of private jet transportation for Itzhak Perlman. It also discusses the construction, naming, and use of the 'Jeffrey E. Epstein Scholarship Lodge'.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Primary donor to Interlochen Center for the Arts, making significant financial contributions and providing private jet transportation. Corresponds regarding the construction and use of a scholarship lodge named after him.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referenced in correspondence regarding the scholarship lodge, with Interlochen staff sending her furniture packages for comment and updating her on lodge matters.

persons.name: Itzhak Perlman
persons.context: Renowned violinist for whom Jeffrey Epstein provided private jet transportation to Interlochen's campus in August 1993.

persons.name: Tim
persons.context: Addressed in a letter from the J. Epstein Foundation regarding a check donation. Likely a staff member at Interlochen Center for the Arts.

connections.description: Epstein is the donor, and Maxwell is involved in the logistics and decisions regarding the scholarship lodge funded by his donations, as staff send furniture packages to her for comment.
Epstein provided private jet transportation for Perlman to travel to Interlochen, which was credited as an in-kind gift.

events.title: Acknowledgement of $15,004 Donation
events.description: Interlochen Center for the Arts thanks Jeffrey Epstein for a $15,004 contribution from the J. Epstein Foundation directed towards a wheelchair-accessible scholarship lodge.

events.title: Thanks for Private Jet Transportation
events.description: Interlochen thanks Jeffrey Epstein for providing private jet transportation for Itzhak Perlman to its campus in August, saving over $12,000 in operational expenses.

events.title: $185,000 Wire Transfer
events.description: Memorandum from Jeffrey Epstein acknowledging the receipt of $185,000 wired into the Interlochen Center for the Arts general account.

events.title: Update on Scholarship Lodge Construction
events.description: Interlochen provides Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell with an update on the construction of the Jeffrey E. Epstein Scholarship Lodge, including design approvals and plans for an endowment fund.

events.title: Itzhak Perlman Concert
events.description: Itzhak Perlman is scheduled to give a concert at Interlochen.

locations: Interlochen Center for the Arts, P.O. Box 199, Interlochen, Michigan 49643-0199
The Villard House, 457 Madison Avenue, New York, NY 10022
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein and his foundation made multiple substantial donations to Interlochen Center for the Arts in 1993-1994, totaling at least $220,004 in direct funds, plus an in-kind private jet gift.
A primary project was funding the 'Jeffrey E. Epstein Scholarship Lodge,' a wheelchair-accessible building intended to generate income for a scholarship endowment in his name.
Epstein provided private jet transportation for famed violinist Itzhak Perlman to travel to Interlochen, which was treated as a charitable in-kind donation.
Ghislaine Maxwell was involved in the lodge project, with Interlochen staff sending her furniture packages for her comments and suggestions.
The correspondence indicates Epstein was permitted personal use of the lodge for two weeks per year without affecting the tax deductibility of his gift.
